channel.title: What the hell is going on with the compilers?
channel.description:
my compiler says: Note: Stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. Press any key to continue(close)
and does it update? (ofcourse not)
so what's the problem with the compiler then?

item.title: What the hell is going on with the compilers?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

[quote=“White Castle, post:5, topic:7041”]String.getBytes() isn’t depracated. getBytes(int srcBegin, int srcEnd, byte[] dst, int dstBegin) is. If you use getBytes() right it works just the same but no ugly warning.

:D

Yeah that’s totally what I meant.

Read full topic
item.source: What the hell is going on with the compilers?

item.title: What the hell is going on with the compilers?
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

String.getBytes() isn’t depracated. getBytes(int srcBegin, int srcEnd, byte[] dst, int dstBegin) is. If you use getBytes() right it works just the same but no ugly warning.

:D

Read full topic

item.title: What the hell is going on with the compilers?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

It means don’t worry about it and be a bit less terse with people who try to answer your questions.

item.source: What the hell is going on with the compilers?

item.title: What the hell is going on with the compilers?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

The problem is that writeString in class Stream uses String.getBytes(), which is a deprecated method.
It’s not something you have to worry about - if you look, you’ll notice that your files have compiled anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: What the hell is going on with the compilers?
